Class User

java.lang.Object
entity.User
Direct Known Subclasses:
CareerCenterStaff, CompanyRep, Student
public class User extends Object
Base user entity shared by students, company representatives, and career center staff.

This class provides fundamental user identity and authentication capabilities that are common across all user types in the system. Concrete user types extend this class to add domain-specific fields, behaviors, and business rules.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Manage user identity and display name
  • Handle password storage and validation
  • Provide secure password change functionality
  • Serve as base class for domain-specific user types

  • Constructor Details

    • User

      public User(String userId, String name)
      Constructs a user with the specified identifier and display name.
      Parameters:
      userId - the unique external identifier (non-null)
      name - the display name for the user
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if userId or name is null or empty

  • Method Details

    • getUserId

      public String getUserId()
      Returns the unique user identifier.
      Returns:
      the user ID

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns the user's display name.
      Returns:
      the display name

    • getPassword

      public String getPassword()
      Returns the stored password hash or value. Note: In a production system, this would typically return a password hash rather than plain text.
      Returns:
      the stored password (may be null if not set)

    • setPassword

      public void setPassword(String password)
      Sets a new password for this user. The password is trimmed and validated to ensure it's not empty.
      Parameters:
      password - the new password to set
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the password is null or empty after trimming

    • checkPassword

      public boolean checkPassword(String attempt)
      Verifies whether a password attempt matches the stored password. Performs a case-sensitive exact match comparison.
      Parameters:
      attempt - the password attempt to verify
      Returns:
      true if the attempt matches the stored password, false otherwise

    • changePassword

      public void changePassword(String currentPassword, String newPassword)
      Changes the user's password after verifying the current password. Provides secure password change functionality with validation:
      • Verifies current password matches
      • Ensures new password is not empty
      • Prevents setting the same password as the current one
      Parameters:
      currentPassword - the user's current password for verification
      newPassword - the desired new password
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if current password is incorrect, new password is empty, or new password is the same as current password
